diseases.details: Fungal infections are caused by fungi and can affect the skin, nails, or internal organs. Treatment involves antifungal medications.
Allergies occur when the immune system reacts to substances (allergens). Symptoms range from mild to severe, and treatment includes antihistamines and avoiding triggers.
Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) is a chronic condition where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus. Management includes lifestyle changes and medications.
Chronic cholestasis is a condition where bile flow from the liver is reduced. Treatment addresses the underlying cause and may involve medications or surgery.
Drug reactions can range from mild to severe and may involve allergies or adverse side effects. Treatment involves discontinuing the offending drug and supportive care.

Peptic ulcers are open sores that develop on the inner lining of the stomach or upper small intestine. Treatment includes antibiotics for H. pylori infection and medications to reduce acid production.
Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) is caused by HIV. Treatment involves antiretroviral therapy to control the virus and support the immune system.
Diabetes is a chronic condition affecting blood sugar levels. Management includes lifestyle changes, medication, and insulin therapy.
Gastroenteritis is inflammation of the stomach and intestines, often caused by viral or bacterial infections. Treatment involves rehydration and symptomatic relief.
Bronchial asthma is a chronic respiratory condition characterized by airway inflammation and narrowing. Treatment includes bronchodilators and anti-inflammatory medications.
Hypertension is high blood pressure. Management involves lifestyle changes and medications to control blood pressure.
Migraines are severe headaches often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light. Treatment includes pain relievers and preventive medications.
Cervical spondylosis is a degenerative condition affecting the neck. Treatment includes pain management, physical therapy, and lifestyle modifications.
Paralysis due to brain hemorrhage results from bleeding in the brain. Treatment involves addressing the cause and rehabilitation.
Jaundice is a yellowing of the skin and eyes due to liver dysfunction. Treatment addresses the underlying cause and may involve supportive care.
Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease. Treatment includes antimalarial medications, and prevention involves mosquito control measures.
Chickenpox is a contagious viral infection. Treatment focuses on symptom relief, and vaccination is available for prevention.
Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral infection. Treatment involves supportive care, and prevention includes mosquito control measures.
Typhoid is a bacterial infection transmitted through contaminated food or water. Treatment includes antibiotics, and prevention involves sanitation measures.
Hepatitis A is a viral liver infection. Treatment involves supportive care, and prevention includes vaccination and hygiene practices.
Hepatitis B is a viral infection affecting the liver. Treatment may involve antiviral medications, and vaccination is available for prevention.
Hepatitis C is a viral infection affecting the liver. Treatment includes antiviral medications, and advancements have been made in recent years.
Hepatitis D is a viral infection that occurs in individuals with hepatitis B. Treatment involves managing symptoms and complications.
Hepatitis E is a viral infection transmitted through contaminated water. Treatment involves supportive care, and prevention focuses on sanitation.
Alcoholic hepatitis is liver inflammation due to excessive alcohol consumption. Treatment involves abstinence and medical management.
Tuberculosis is a bacterial infection affecting the lungs. Treatment includes antibiotics, and prevention involves vaccination and infection control measures.
The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract. Treatment involves symptom relief, rest, and hydration.
Pneumonia is an infection affecting the lungs. Treatment includes antibiotics, rest, and supportive care.
Dimorphic hemorrhoids, or piles, are swollen blood vessels in the rectum or anus. Treatment includes lifestyle changes, medications, and, in severe cases, surgery.
A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked. Treatment involves emergency medical care, medications, and lifestyle changes.
Varicose veins are swollen and twisted veins. Treatment includes lifestyle changes, compression stockings, and, in severe cases, medical procedures.
Hypothyroidism is a thyroid disorder characterized by low thyroid hormone levels. Treatment involves thyroid hormone replacement therapy.
Hyperthyroidism is a thyroid disorder characterized by excess thyroid hormone levels. Treatment includes medications, radioactive iodine, or surgery.
Hypoglycemia is low blood sugar levels. Treatment involves consuming glucose-rich foods or medications to raise blood sugar.
Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease. Treatment includes pain management, physical therapy, and, in severe cases, joint replacement.
Arthritis is inflammation of the joints, leading to pain and stiffness. Treatment includes medications, physical therapy, and lifestyle modifications.
Vertigo is a sensation of spinning or dizziness. Paroxysmal positional vertigo (PPV) is a common cause. Treatment involves repositioning maneuvers and medications.
Acne is a skin condition characterized by pimples and inflammation. Treatment includes topical or oral medications, lifestyle changes, and proper skincare.
A urinary tract infection (UTI) is a bacterial infection affecting the urinary system. Treatment involves antibiotics and increased fluid intake.
Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition characterized by red, scaly patches. Treatment includes topical medications, phototherapy, and systemic medications.
Impetigo is a bacterial skin infection. Treatment involves antibiotics, and good hygiene practices help prevent its spread.
